workflow.name: AI marketing report (Google Analytics & Ads, Meta Ads), sent via email/Telegram
workflow.description:
## What this workflow does
This workflow retrieves Online Marketing data (Google Analytics for several domains, Google Ads, Meta Ads) from the last 7 days and the same period in the previous year. The data is then prepared by AI as a table, analyzed and provided with a small summary.
The summary is then sent by email to a desired address and, shortened and summarized again, sent to a Telegram account.

This workflow has the following sequence:

1. time trigger (e.g. every Monday at 7 a.m.)
2. retrieval of Online Marketing data from the last 7 days (via sub workflows)
3. assignment and summary of the data
4. retrieval of Online Marketing data from the same time period of the previous year
5. allocation and summary of the data
6. preparation in tabular form and brief analysis by AI.
7. sending the report as an email
8. preparation in short form by AI for Telegram (optional)
9. sending as Telegram message.

## Requirements
The following accesses are required for the workflow:
- Google Analytics (via Google Analytics API): [Documentation](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/credentials/google/)
- Google Ads (via HTTP Request -> Google Ads API):[Documentation](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/credentials/google/)
- Meta Ads (via Facebook Graph API): [Documentation](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/credentials/facebookgraph/)
- AI API access (e.g. via OpenAI, Anthropic, Google or Ollama)
- SMTP access data (for sending the mail)
- Telegram access data (optional for sending as Telegram message): [Documentation](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/credentials/telegram/)

You must set up the individual sub-workflows as separate workflows. Then set the “Execute workflow trigger” here. Then select the corresponding sub-workflow in the AI Agent Tools.
You can select the number of domains yourself. If the data queries are not required, simply delete the corresponding tool (e.g. “Analytics_Domain_5).

Feel free to [contact me via LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/friedemann-schuetz), if you have any questions!

nodes.name: Call Google Analytics data: Last 7 days
Call Google Analytics data: Last 7 days (previous year)
Calculate date format for Google Ads request (last 7 days)
Call Google Ads Data: Last 7 days

parameters.name: query
parameters.value:
=SELECT
   campaign.name,
   metrics.impressions,
   metrics.average_cpm,
   metrics.clicks, 
   metrics.ctr,
   metrics.conversions,
   metrics.cost_per_conversion,
   metrics.cost_micros,
   metrics.conversions_value
FROM campaign
WHERE segments.date >= '{{ $json.startDate }}' AND segments.date <= '{{ $json.endDate }}'

nodes.name: Call Google Ads Data: Last 7 days (previous year)

parameters.value:

   metrics.cost_micros,
   metrics.conversions_value
FROM campaign
WHERE segments.date >= '{{ $json.startDate }}' AND segments.date <= '{{ $json.endDate }}'

values.content:
=Please analyze the following data and output the results in table form:

| Metric | Last 7 Days | Previous Year | Percentage Change |
|--------|-------------|---------------|-------------------|
| Total Impressions | {{$json.current_impressions}} | {{$json.previous_impressions}} | Percentage Change |
| CPM | {{$json.current_cpm}} | {{$json.previous_cpm}} | Percentage Change |
| Total Clicks | {{$json.current_clicks}} | {{$json.previous_clicks}} | Percentage Change |
| CTR | {{$json.current_ctr}} | {{$json.previous_ctr}} | Percentage Change |
| Conversions | {{$json.current_conversions}} | {{$json.previous_conversions}} | Percentage Change |
| Cost per Conversion | {{$json.current_cost_per_conversion}} | {{$json.previous_cost_per_conversion}} | Percentage Change |
| ROAS | {{ $json.current_roas }} | {{ $json.previous_roas }} | Percentage Change |
| Costs | {{$json.current_cost}} | {{$json.previous_cost}} | Percentage Change |

Number format:
- Period (.) for thousands (e.g. 4.000)
- Comma (,) for decimal numbers (e.g. 3,4)
- Display CPM, Cost per Conversion, ROAS and Costs in €
- CTR in percent

Please write a brief summary of the analyzed data above the table (in max 3 sentences!)

IMPORTANT:
Write nothing except the summary and the table below it!
NO INTRODUCTION, NO CONCLUSION!

=Please analyze the following data and output the results in table form:

| Metric | Last 7 Days | Previous Year | Percentage Change |
|--------|-------------|---------------|-------------------|
| Total Impressions | {{$json.current_impressions}} | {{$json.previous_impressions}} | Percentage Change |

Number format:
- Period (.) for thousands (e.g. 4.000)
- Comma (,) for decimal numbers (e.g. 3,4)
- Display CPM, Cost per Conversion, ROAS and Costs in €
- CTR in percent

Please write a brief summary of the analyzed data above the table (in max 3 sentences!)

IMPORTANT:
Write nothing except the summary and the table below it!
NO INTRODUCTION, NO CONCLUSION!

=Please analyze the following data and output the results in table form:
| Metric                        | Last 7 Days | Previous Year | Percentage Change |
|-------------------------------|-------------|---------------|-------------------|
| Total Page Views              | {{ $('Summarize Google Analytics input (current year)').item.json.sum_Page_views }} | {{ $json.sum_Page_views }} | Percentage Change |
| Total Users                   | {{ $('Summarize Google Analytics input (current year)').item.json.sum_Users }} | {{ $json.sum_Users }} | Percentage Change |
| Total Sessions                | {{ $('Summarize Google Analytics input (current year)').item.json.sum_Sessions }} | {{ $json.sum_Sessions }} | Percentage Change |
| Average Sessions per User     | {{ $('Summarize Google Analytics input (current year)').item.json.average_Sessions_per_user }} | {{ $json.average_Sessions_per_user }} | Percentage Change |
| Average Session Duration      | {{ $('Summarize Google Analytics input (current year)').item.json.average_Session_duration }} | {{ $json.average_Session_duration }} | Percentage Change |
| Total Purchases               | {{ $('Summarize Google Analytics input (current year)').item.json.sum_Conversions }} | {{ $json.sum_Conversions }} | Percentage Change |
| Average Revenue per Purchase  | {{ $('Summarize Google Analytics input (current year)').item.json.average_Value_per_Conversion }} | {{ $json.average_Value_per_conversion }} | Percentage Change |
| Total Revenue                 | {{ $('Summarize Google Analytics input (current year)').item.json.sum_Revenue }} | {{ $('Summarize Google Analytics input (previous year)').item.json.sum_Revenue }} | Percentage Change |

Number format:
- Period (.) for thousands (e.g. 4.000)
- Comma (,) for decimal numbers (e.g. 3,4)
- Convert Average Session Duration to minutes instead of seconds
- Average Revenue per Purchase and Total Revenue in €

Please write a brief summary of the analyzed data above the table (in max 3 sentences!)

IMPORTANT:
Write nothing except the summary and the table below it!
NO INTRODUCTION, NO CONCLUSION!

=Convert the following text from HTML to plain text:

{{ $json.output }}

Please format the table so that each evaluation (Domain 1, Domain 2, Domain 3, Domain 4, Domain 5, Google Ads, Meta Ads) is its own paragraph! Also, please display only the summary (without the table), but incorporate the numbers into the running text!

Example:

Domain 1:
xx,xxx page views (+x.xx%)
xx,xxx users (-x.xx%)

Domain 2:
xx,xxx page views (+x.xx%)
xx,xxx users (-x.xx%)

<userStyle>Normal</userStyle>

parameters.text:
=# Expert in Data Processing and Email Generation in N8N YOU ARE AN EXPERT IN DATA PROCESSING AND EMAIL GENERATION IN N8N. YOUR TASK IS TO CREATE AN ENGLISH-LANGUAGE HTML EMAIL THAT COMPREHENSIVELY SUMMARIZES GOOGLE ANALYTICS AND GOOGLE ADS DATA FROM VARIOUS WORKFLOWS. YOU MUST FORMAT THE CAPTURED DATA ACCORDING TO THE SPECIFIED SPECIFICATIONS AND DESIGN THE EMAIL FOR OPTIMAL READABILITY. ## Instructions ### 1. Collect Summary - First, retrieve the summary and table for `Analytics_Domain_1` from the `Analytics_Domain_1` workflow. - Second, retrieve the summary and table for `Analytics_Domain_2` from the `Analytics_Domain_2` workflow. - Third, retrieve the summary and table for `Analytics_Domain_3` from the `Analytics_Domain_3` workflow. - Fourth, retrieve the summary and table for `Analytics_Domain_4` from the `Analytics_Domain_4` workflow. - Fifth, retrieve the summary and table for `Analytics_Domain_5` from the `Analytics_Domain_5` workflow. - Sixth, retrieve the summary and table for `Google_Ads` from the `Google_Ads` workflow. - Seventh, retrieve the summary and table for `Meta_Ads` from the `Meta_Ads` workflow. ### 2. Email Structure - Begin the email with the following introduction: "Hi Freddy, Here is your weekly Online Marketing Report for the last 7 days from Domain 1, Domain 2, Domain 3, Domain 4, Domain 5, as well as Google Ads and Meta Ads!" - Create a separate section for each dataset: - **Domain 1**: Contains the summary and table from `Analytics_Domain_1` - **Domain 2**: Contains the summary and table from `Analytics_Domain_2` - **Domain 3**: Contains the summary and table from `Analytics_Domain_3` - **Domain 4**: Contains the summary and table from `Analytics_Domain_4` - **Domain 5**: Contains the summary and table from `Analytics_Domain_5` - **Google Ads**: Contains the summary and table from `Google Ads` - **Meta Ads**: Contains the summary and table from `Meta Ads` - Present the sections clearly and readably as HTML. ### 3. Design and Formatting - Use simple HTML structures with clear section titles (e.g., `

` for titles). - Present the summary as a paragraph (e.g., `

`). - The table should be cleanly formatted (e.g., with ``, ``, `
`). - Keep the presentation clear and easy to read. ### 4. No Conclusion, No Signature ### HTML Output Structure ```html

Hi,

Here is your weekly Online Marketing Report for the last 7 days from Domain 1, Domain 2, Domain 3, Domain 4, Domain 5, as well as Google Ads and Meta Ads!

Domain 1

[Summary from Analytics_Domain_1 will be inserted here]

[Table content from Analytics_Domain_1 will be inserted here]

Domain 2

[Summary from Analytics_Domain_2 will be inserted here]

[Table content from Analytics_Domain_2 will be inserted here]
``` ### 5. Output - Format the entire HTML content as a string for email transmission. ### What Not to Do - No unwanted closings or signatures - No unstructured, hard-to-read data formatting - No missing sections or titles - No copying of data without HTML formatting

parameters.content:
Welcome to Online Marketing Weekly Report Workflow!

This workflow has the following sequence:

1. time trigger (e.g. every Monday at 7 a.m.)
2. retrieval of Online Marketing data from the last 7 days (via sub workflows)
3. assignment and summary of the data
4. retrieval of Online Marketing data from the same time period of the previous year
5. allocation and summary of the data
6. preparation in tabular form and brief analysis by AI.
7. sending the report as an email
8. preparation in short form by AI for Telegram (optional)
9. sending as Telegram message.

The following accesses are required for the workflow:
- Google Analytics (via Google Analytics API): [Documentation](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/credentials/google/)
- Google Ads (via HTTP Request -> Google Ads API):[Documentation](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/credentials/google/)
- Meta Ads (via Facebook Graph API): [Documentation](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/credentials/facebookgraph/)
- AI API access (e.g. via OpenAI, Anthropic, Google or Ollama)
- SMTP access data (for sending the mail)
- Telegram access data (optional for sending as Telegram message): [Documentation](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/credentials/telegram/)

You can contact me via LinkedIn, if you have any questions: https://www.linkedin.com/in/friedemann-schuetz
